title: Add reusable url Zod schema for URL props
description: Add a shared url Zod schema that normalizes imported static URLs and replaces direct z.string() usages for URL-like props across multiple files.
body:
### Motivation

- Imported static URLs can sometimes be objects like `{ default: "..." }` due to bundlers, so validation should be tolerant and normalize those to strings before type-checking.

### Description

- Add a shared `url` Zod schema in `lib/common/url.ts` that `preprocess`-es values by unwrapping `{ default: ... }` and then validates as `z.string()`.
- Replace direct `z.string()` usages for URL-like props with the new `url` schema in `lib/common/cadModel.ts`, `lib/components/cadmodel.ts`, `lib/common/layout.ts`, `lib/components/group.ts`, and `lib/platformConfig.ts`, and update `cadmodelProps` to accept `url`.
- Regenerate the component types documentation so the new `url` schema is reflected in `generated/COMPONENT_TYPES.md`.

### Testing

- Ran the generation scripts `bun scripts/generate-component-types.ts`, `bun scripts/generate-manual-edits-docs.ts`, `bun scripts/generate-readme-docs.ts`, and `bun scripts/generate-props-overview.ts`, and they completed successfully.
- Ran `bunx tsc --noEmit` to type-check the project and it succeeded.
- Ran `bun run format` to format files and it completed successfully.

------

title: Allow via entries in trace pcbPath
description: Permit pcbPath route points to express vias so traces can include layer transitions in path descriptions and enforce validation rules for via-related inputs.
body:
### Motivation

- Permit pcbPath route points to express vias so traces can include layer transitions in path descriptions.
- Enforce that when a point is marked `via: true` it must declare a `toLayer`, and forbid layer fields on non-via points to prevent ambiguous input.

### Description

- Add a `pcbPathPoint` schema in `lib/components/trace.ts` that extends the existing `point` with `via?: boolean`, `fromLayer?: layer_ref`, and `toLayer?: layer_ref` and applies a `superRefine` to validate the via-related rules. 
- Replace the previous `pcbPath` type with an array of `pcbPathPoint | string` so string selectors remain supported. 
- Add a test `tests/trace.test.ts` to cover pcbPath entries containing a via with `toLayer` specified. 
- Regenerate documentation artifacts so `generated/COMPONENT_TYPES.md` reflects the new pcbPath/via shape.

### Testing

- Ran `bun test tests/trace.test.ts`, which passed 5 tests and 0 failures. 
- Ran `bunx tsc --noEmit` to typecheck the project, which completed successfully. 
- Ran the repository generation scripts (`scripts/generate-component-types.ts`, `scripts/generate-manual-edits-docs.ts`, `scripts/generate-readme-docs.ts`, `scripts/generate-props-overview.ts`) and `bun run format`, all of which completed without errors and updated generated documentation.

title: Store blob URLs for STEP conversions in local registry, allows loading boards with many identical STEP models more quickly
description: Centralizes blob URL storage for STEP conversions to avoid duplicates and improve loading efficiency for boards with identical STEP models.
body:
### Motivation
- Avoid creating duplicate object URLs for the same converted STEP file by centralizing both the binary and its blob URL in a shared registry.
- Make caching and revocation behavior consistent across components by keeping conversion state (in-progress and completed) as a single source of truth.

### Description
- Introduced `ConvertedStepFile` (`{ arrayBuffer, blobUrl }`) and updated `StepUrlConversionRegistry` to hold `Promise<ConvertedStepFile>` in `inProgress` and `ConvertedStepFile` in `completed`.
- Changed `convertStepUrlToGlb` to return an `ArrayBuffer` and generate a single `blobUrl` when resolving a conversion, storing both in the registry.
- Updated the `StepModel` effect to consult `localStorage` and the registry, reuse existing `blobUrl` from `completed` entries or join `inProgress` promises, create and store `ConvertedStepFile` when needed, and only revoke object URLs when appropriate.
- Ensured `setCachedGlb` continues to persist the `arrayBuffer` and registry `inProgress` entries are removed on error.

### Testing
- Ran type checking with `bunx tsc --noEmit`, which succeeded.
- Ran formatter with `bun run format`, which succeeded.

title: Force WebGL context loss on OrientationCubeCanvas cleanup to prevent GPU leaks
description: Explicitly calls renderer.forceContextLoss() during unmount to ensure the WebGL context is fully released, preventing GPU memorycontext leaks during remounts or viewer reinitialization.
body:
Explicitly calls renderer.forceContextLoss() during unmount

Ensures the WebGL context is fully released, not just the scene and renderer objects

Prevents GPU memory/context leaks during remounts or viewer reinitialization

Improves stability in long-running sessions and repeated canvas lifecycles

This change tightens resource cleanup and avoids lingering WebGL contexts that renderer.dispose() alone does not fully release.

title: Fix floating bottom-layer CAD components to correctly align it components with board surface
description: Fixes alignment issue of bottom-layer CAD components with the board surface by removing an unnecessary offset in the z-position calculation.

title: Improve Rendering Performance by Capping Board Texture Resolution Based on Board Size
description: Capping board texture resolution based on board size to prevent oversized layer textures and reduce GPU memory pressure, improving stability and performance on large boards.
body:
Renames and introduces getLayerTextureResolution to compute a safe, board-aware texture resolution from board dimensions.

Applies the computed resolution consistently across all texture-rendered board layers (traces, soldermask, silkscreen, copper text, copper pours, panel outlines).

Skips copper-pour geometry processing since pours are rendered purely as textures.

Forces WebGL context loss on canvas disposal to prevent GPU resource leaks.

Accurate impact:

Prevents oversized layer textures

Reduces GPU memory pressure

Improves stability and performance on large boards

No overreachthis change is about bounded texture sizing and correct resource cleanup.

title: Support vias in manual `pcbPath` and add square multilayer snapshot
description: Adds support for vias in manual pcbPath routes, allowing users to specify layer transitions and ensuring inner layer traces remain visible in rendered paths.
body:
### Motivation
- Manual `pcbPath` routes must support `via: true` and explicit `fromLayer`/`toLayer` so users can place layer transitions (including inner layers) in manual traces. 
- The test should exercise a square-shaped path so `inner1`/`inner2` traces remain visible and are not visually obscured by a top-layer segment.

### Description
- Implemented `via` handling in `Trace_doInitialPcbManualTraceRender.ts` by recognizing `pcbPath` points with `via`, emitting `route_type: "via"` entries, tracking a `currentLayer` and switching it after vias, and emitting subsequent `wire` segments on the correct layer. 
- Insert `pcb_via` records for each `via` using `getViaDiameterDefaults` so hole/pad sizes are populated. 
- Added a `ManualPcbPathPoint` type and accept `pcbPath` entries that are either string selectors or objects with `x`, `y`, optional `via`, `fromLayer`, and `toLayer`. 
- Added a snapshot test `tests/components/primitive-components/trace-pcb-path-vias.test.tsx` and corresponding SVG snapshot that routes a square path across `top`, `inner1`, and `inner2` so inner-layer traces are visible.

### Testing
- Ran `BUN_UPDATE_SNAPSHOTS=1 bun test tests/components/primitive-components/trace-pcb-path-vias.test.tsx` and the test passed (1 pass, 0 fail). 
- Ran `bunx tsc --noEmit` for type-checking and it completed without reporting new errors for the modified code. 
- Ran `bun run format` which completed successfully.

title: Add timeout guidance for DevServer file upserts
description: Adds a centralized helper for file upsert requests and provides actionable timeout guidance for users when uploads to the local file server fail due to timeout errors.
body:
### Motivation
- Provide clearer diagnostics and actionable guidance when uploads to the local file server time out (the stacktrace showed a `TimeoutError` on POST `/api/files/upsert`).

### Description
- Import `TimeoutError` from `ky` and add a centralized `postFileUpsert` helper to route all file upsert requests through a single call site. 
- Replace scattered direct `this.fsKy.post("api/files/upsert", ...)` calls with the new helper in file-change, rename, initial upload, and node_modules upload flows. 
- Add `logFileUpsertTimeout` which detects `TimeoutError` and prints colored, actionable guidance including the local file server URL and suggestions to check dev server startup and port availability. 
- Adjust the helper parameter typing to align with the existing `initiator` usage.

### Testing
- Ran `bunx tsc --noEmit` to typecheck the project and it succeeded. 
- Ran `bun run format` to apply formatting and it completed successfully.

title: Add `tsci doctor` diagnostics command
description: Add a tsci doctor command that runs a set of targeted environment checks to help users diagnose tscircuit auth and registry problems, including checks for session token and npm registry configuration.
body:
### Motivation
- Provide a single `tsci doctor` command that runs a set of targeted environment checks to help users diagnose tscircuit auth and registry problems.
- Make checks modular so each diagnostic lives in its own file/function and can be extended with more checks later.

### Description
- Add a per-check type `DoctorCheckResult` and implement `checkLoggedIn` in `cli/doctor/checks/check-login.ts` to verify an active session token with `getSessionToken` and return a descriptive error if missing.
- Implement `checkGlobalNpmrcRegistry` in `cli/doctor/checks/check-npmrc-registry.ts` which creates a temporary project, runs `bun install` with `BUN_DEBUG=network`, and inspects Bun output to determine whether requests went to `npm.tscircuit.com` and an auth token was sent, returning clear, actionable messages for each failure mode.
- Add `runDoctor` in `cli/doctor/run-doctor.ts` to run checks, format results with checkbox / red-cross icons using `kleur`, print details, and set a non-zero exit code if any checks fail, and register the `doctor` command via `cli/doctor/register.ts` and `cli/main.ts`.
- Update dependencies/lockfile as part of the change (small `kleur` refresh reflected in `bun.lock`).

### Testing
- Ran TypeScript typecheck with `bunx tsc --noEmit`, which completed successfully.
- Ran code formatter with `bun run format`, which completed successfully and formatted files.

title: Fix incorrect trace segment layers in multi-layer pcbPath routing by propagating last-known layer and enabling inner-layer KiCad SVG snapshots
description: Fixes a layer-assignment bug when converting trace.route into KiCad PCB segments, ensuring segments are exported onto the correct layer by deriving each segments layer from startPoint.layer, endPoint.layer, or lastKnownLayer, and updating lastKnownLayer as it walks the route.
body:
This PR fixes a layer-assignment bug when converting trace.route into KiCad PCB segments: if intermediate route points omit layer, segments could be exported onto the wrong layer (or default incorrectly). The converter now derives each segments layer from startPoint.layer ?? endPoint.layer ?? lastKnownLayer, while updating lastKnownLayer as it walks the route, ensuring continuous routing stays on the intended layer across vias and unlabeled points.

Test coverage is expanded with new 4-layer pcbPath via scenarios (Inner1Bottom and Inner1Inner2), asserting vias and expected In1.Cu / In2.Cu / B.Cu segments. Snapshot generation is also updated to include In1.Cu and In2.Cu in KiCad SVG exports, making inner-layer routing visible and preventing false-negative snapshot diffs.

title: Fix tests: derived-table setup + cf-proxy test env
description: Fixes test failures by creating derived-table schemas in the test environment and replacing external Cloudflare test dependencies with an in-memory KV harness for deterministic unit tests.
body:
### Motivation
- Tests were failing because derived-table schemas were not being created in the test environment and cf-proxy tests depended on `cloudflare:test` which is not available in CI. 
- Provide a light-weight, reusable way to create derived tables for tests without full data population. 
- Replace the external Cloudflare test dependency with an in-memory KV and worker harness so cf-proxy unit tests run deterministically.

### Description
- Add a reusable helper `setupDerivedTables` in `lib/db/derivedtables/setup-derived-tables.ts` that creates derived-table schemas and can optionally populate them (`populate` toggle). 
- Wire the helper into the CLI script by updating `scripts/setup-derived-tables.ts` to call `setupDerivedTables` (with logging). 
- Ensure tests create required table schemas by calling `setupDerivedTables({ populate: false })` in `tests/preload.ts` so tests get schemas without heavy population. 
- Replace `cloudflare:test` usage with an in-memory KV harness: add `cf-proxy/test/test-env.ts` (a `MemoryKV`, `createTestEnv`, and `createSelf`), and update `cf-proxy/test/cache-service.test.ts` and `cf-proxy/test/worker.test.ts` to use that harness and to stub origin fetch behavior for deterministic worker tests.

### Testing
- Ran `bun test` and all tests passed (96 passed, 0 failed). 
- Ran TypeScript check with `bunx tsc --noEmit` which completed without type errors. 
- Ran formatter with `bun run format` which completed successfully.

title: improve schematic text positioning and offsets for {REF}
description: Refactors schematic component text positioning by removing manual offset calculations and simplifying alignment logic for SVG output.
body: This PR refactors how schematic component text (Reference Designators and Values) is positioned and aligned in the SVG output. It removes complex manual offset calculations and "threshold" logic, moving instead toward a more robust mapping of component anchors to SVG dominant-baseline and text-anchor attributes. Changes - Removed manual offsets: Deleted DEFAULT_TEXT_OFFSET_FACTOR, REFERENCE_TEXT_OFFSET_FACTOR, and other related multipliers used to manually shift text position. - Simplified positioning logic: Removed the logic that attempted to "treat as top/bottom" based on coordinate thresholds. - Direct Anchor Mapping: Replaced manual dominantBaseline calculation with a direct lookup from the ninePointAnchorToDominantBaseline record using the text's defined anchor. - Cleanup: Removed unused scale calculations (symbolToScreenScale) and streamlined the fontSizePx retrieval. - Snapshots: Updated SVG snapshots (e.g., 555timer.snap.svg) to reflect the new coordinate and connectivity map ID changes.

title: Fix header menu alignment: keep View menu adjacent to File
description: Fixes header menu alignment to ensure the View menu remains adjacent to the File menu, preventing UX confusion due to right-alignment.
body:
### Motivation
- The `View` dropdown could become right-aligned and separate from the `File` menu depending on surrounding header layout, causing UX confusion.
- The header should keep `File` and `View` grouped so they always appear together regardless of other header content.

### Description
- Wrap the `File` and `View` dropdown triggers in a single flex container (`div` with `rf-flex rf-items-center rf-gap-1 rf-flex-shrink-0`) to ensure they stay aligned together.
- Move and reorganize the dropdown markup in `lib/components/FileMenuLeftHeader.tsx` so both triggers share the same container while preserving existing menu contents and behavior.
- Run code formatting as part of the change to normalize whitespace and style.

### Testing
- Ran `bunx tsc --noEmit` to typecheck the project, which completed successfully.
- Ran `bun run format` which formatted files (no functional changes reported by the formatter aside from style).
- Launched the local Cosmos preview and captured a Playwright screenshot to visually verify the header menus remain adjacent (screenshot produced successfully).

It also updates dependencies and cleans up unused files. **Component and Footprint Refactoring:** * Replaces the custom `chip` definition for U1 with a new `QRE1113GR` component, which includes a precise footprint and CAD model for the QRE1113GR sensor (`boards/SparkFun-RedBot-Sensor-Line-Follower/ C232862.tsx`, them with standard footprint identifiers for the pin header (`pinrow3_smd_rightangle`) and resistors (`0603`) (`boards/SparkFun-RedBot-Sensor-Line Follower/footprints.tsx`, title: Replace Laser Profile <select> with dismissible dropdown menu that supports in-place deletion of custom profiles
description: Replaces the native select for Laser Profiles with a custom dropdown menu that allows for in-place deletion of custom profiles and one-click creation of new profiles.
body:
This PR upgrades the Laser Profile picker UX in **SettingsPanel**:

* Replaces the native `<select>` with a custom dropdown menu showing the current profile and a chevron trigger.
* Adds **outside-click** and **Escape-key** dismissal for the menu.
* Introduces **one-click creation** via a compact + button (opens the existing `LaserProfileDialog`).
* Enables **safe deletion** of **custom** profiles directly from the menu (built-in profiles are protected).
* Ensures stability: if the **currently selected** custom profile is deleted, the app **falls back to `Default`** and updates `lbrnOptions.laserProfile` accordingly.

title: Add resolveStaticAsset support for CadViewer model URLs
description: Add resolveStaticAsset support for CadViewer model URLs, allowing consumers to map placeholder or repo-relative model identifiers to real CDNbundled URLs before loading 3D models.
body:
### Motivation

- Allow consumers to map placeholder or repo-relative model identifiers to real CDN/bundled URLs before the viewer attempts to load 3D models.

### Description

- Add a small utility `resolveModelUrl` in `src/utils/resolve-model-url.ts` that applies an optional `resolveStaticAsset` function to a model URL. 
- Plumb the `resolveStaticAsset` prop through `CadViewer` into both engines by adding the prop to `CadViewerJscad` and `CadViewerManifold` and passing it to `AnyCadComponent`.
- Apply the resolver inside `AnyCadComponent` so OBJ/WRL/STL, GLTF/GLB and STEP URLs are transformed before loading.
- Add a Storybook example `stories/ResolveStaticAsset.stories.tsx` demonstrating mapping a placeholder URL to a bundled `.glb`, and update `README.md` to document the new `resolveStaticAsset` prop.

### Testing

- Ran unit tests: `bun test tests/resolve-model-url.test.ts` which passed (3 tests, 0 failures). 
- Built the package: `bun run build` (TypeScript build and type declarations succeeded).
- The story demonstrating the prop was added as `stories/ResolveStaticAsset.stories.tsx` for manual verification in Storybook.

------

body:
Introduces a new Polygon primitive to the graphics model with full type safety.

Adds polygon rendering to Canvas and SVG pipelines, including bounds, transforms, and optional labels.

Enables interactive polygons (hover, click, tooltips) with layer/step filtering and viewport culling.

Extends utilities (merge, translate, step filtering, bounds, tables) to treat polygons as first-class objects.

Includes fixtures, examples, CI type-checking, and snapshot tests to validate end-to-end behavior.

title: support for 0603 patterns
description: This pull request introduces support for 0603 jumper patterns in the autorouting pipeline. It includes modifications to various components to accommodate the new jumper type, including the addition of new grid generation logic, updates to existing solver classes, and the introduction of new test fixtures to validate the changes. The changes ensure that the autorouter can effectively utilize 0603 jumpers alongside existing jumper types, enhancing the flexibility and capability of the routing engine.

title: Add full SparkFun Logic Level Converter (bi-directional) PCB + schematic
description: Adds a complete, production-grade SparkFun Logic Level Converter (bi-directional) board to sparkfun-boards, including schematic and PCB, with a new BSS138 MOSFET component and supporting documentation.
body: This pull request introduces a new implementation of the SparkFun Logic Level Converter Bi-Directional board in the codebase. It adds a parametric, programmatic definition of the board, including its schematic, layout, and all required components. The main changes include the creation of a reusable `BSS138` MOSFET component, a full board circuit definition, and supporting documentation. Adds a complete, production-grade SparkFun Logic Level Converter (bi-directional) board to sparkfun-boards, including schematic + PCB. Documents part placement, nets, and connectors so its ready for downstream rendering/autoroute pipelines. Scope: new full board (PCB + schematic), not a toy example; includes BOM annotations and layer data. Impact: expands the SparkFun library with a ready-to-use level shifter board for multi-voltage designs. title: Add full STEP support for pill & rotated pill PCB holes  fix missing/incorrect hole geometry and wall faces in exports
description: Adds complete geometry generation for pill and rotated pill hole shapes during Circuit JSON to STEP conversion, fixing inaccurate or missing hole representation in exported models.
body:
This PR adds complete geometry generation for `pill` and `rotated_pill` hole shapes during Circuit JSON  STEP conversion, fixing inaccurate or missing hole representation in exported models.

### Key improvements

* Implemented `pill-geometry.ts` to compute pill parameters, arcs, and straight segments.
* Generated proper bottom/top edge loops for pill holes (semicircles + linear edges).
* Added cylindrical end-cap faces and planar side walls for correct 3D hole extrusion through board thickness.
* Integrated new logic into `circuitJsonToStep` for both loop creation and wall face generation.
* Updated repro tests and snapshots to reflect accurate STEP output.

### Impact

* STEP exports now correctly represent pill-shaped plated/non-plated holes.
* Eliminates geometry gaps and incorrect cylindrical-only assumptions.
* Improves downstream CAD compatibility and mechanical accuracy.

title: Fix duplicate ports in custom symbol KiCad output
description: Fixes duplicate ports in custom symbols generated for KiCad output by implementing a two-step port resolution process to ensure only unique ports are retained.
body: Problem: Custom symbols generated duplicate ports in KiCad output - one at the custom position and one at the auto-generated position. Solution: Two-step port resolution: 1. First try: Filter ports with display_pin_label (custom symbol named ports like B, C, E) 2. Second try: If none found, deduplicate by pin_number, keeping first occurrence Additional changes: - Grid-aligned scale (15.24) for custom symbols - Fixed pin angles to point toward symbol body - Pin length 2.54 for custom symbols Before: Not able to connect wires Final result:

title: Fix faint pcb_board outline at low zoom by clamping to a minimum on-screen stroke width
description: Fixes faint pcb_board outline rendering at low zoom levels by introducing a minimum stroke width option for better visibility.
body: Addresses **TSC-345** ([Linear](https://linear.app/tscircuit/issue/TSC-345/figure-out-how-to-make-board-outlines-more-visible-strokewidth-scaling)): figure out how to make board outlines more visible when zoomed out. ### What changed * Added an **opt-in** `minBoardOutlineStrokePx` option to `CircuitToCanvasDrawer.drawElements`. * Threaded the option into `drawPcbBoard` and applied it **only** to the `pcb_board` outline path rendering. * Extended `drawPath` with optional `minStrokePx` and clamps the computed outline line width **only when provided**. ### Testing * Verified via `bun link` with **pcb-viewer** using `minBoardOutlineStrokePx: 2` px. ### Before ### After
